name: CRC 2025
description: I attend the Cloud Resume Challenge this year using the GCP provider. You can find the Github link below.
body_html:
üèÜ Cloud Resume Challenge (Google Cloud Platform)

The Cloud Resume Challenge is a hands-on project designed for cloud professionals. My goal was to design and deploy my online portfolio within two weeks using IaC on Google Cloud Platform (GCP).

üöÄ Skills

This end-to-end project validated key skills in Cloud Engineering (DevOps/Cloud Computing), and Infrastructure as Code (IaC).

üõ†Ô∏è GCP Services & Tools

  • Infrastructure as Code (IaC) : Terraform / Ansible
  • Frontend Hosting : GCP Cloud Storage
  • Backend Serverless : GCP Cloud Functions
  • Database : Google Firestore
  • Caching / CDN : Cloudflare

üéØ Key Achievements and Learnings

1. Infrastructure as Code (IaC)

  • Provisioned and managed the complete GCP stack (Cloud Storage, Cloud Functions, and Firestore) with Terraform.
  • Ensured a reproducible and version-controlled infrastructure.

2. Architecture Frontend et Distribution

  • Application hosting via GCP Cloud Storage Bucket.
  • Configured Cloudflare for caching and Content Delivery Network (CDN), demonstrating a cost-effective approach compared to GCP's Cloud CDN or Load Balancing.

3. Backend Serverless and Database

  • Architected and implemented a serverless API powered by Cloud Functions to manage backend business logic.
  • Implemented API endpoints to retrieve and update view counts for the project page.
  • Leveraged Google Firestore (NoSQL) for visitor counter data storage and persistence.

Skills Summary

  • Cloud Computing (GCP)
  • Architecture Serverless
  • Infrastructure as Code (Terraform / Ansible)
  • API REST & Firestore
  • FinOps
